translation:
The undersigned Captain Roberto G. Bisley, Jerônimo Teixeira de Almeida, and Domingos José de Almeida, wishing to cooperate with all their strength in the prompt recognition of the Riograndense Republic, have agreed to arm at their own expense a schooner to engage in privateering on the high seas in the waters of the Rio Grande bar against the vessels of the subjects of the Emperor of Brazil, simultaneously deriving all the advantages that may be obtained therefrom, and for such purposes, mutually bind themselves to the conditions set forth in the following articles:

Article 1 — For the purchase of a schooner that is to cruise in the waters of the Rio Grande bar to harass the subjects of the Government of Brazil, its equipment, armament, and advances to the crew, each partner is obliged to deliver in Montevideo to the partner Captain Roberto Bisley, or to whom he determines, the sum of 750 patacões in sound money.

Article 2 — The said partner Captain Roberto is responsible for the purchase of the mentioned schooner, its equipment and armament, as well as its command, the management of prizes, and everything else relating to the privateering, according to the Regulation of November 12, 1836, and other instructions received with his commission of this Republic; for the work of armament and equipment he will demand nothing, but regarding prizes, as commander of the privateer, he shall have in all five percent beyond the share corresponding to him as shipowner.

Article 3 — Partner Jerônimo is responsible for proceeding to Mostardas as soon as he is informed of the purchase and departure of the privateer schooner, maintaining sentinels on the coast to observe where the prize runs aground, encouraging its unloading, managing the goods, and keeping clear records and notices to the other partners.

Article 4 — Partner Almeida is responsible for negotiating with the Government of the Republic the necessary orders and measures to protect the unloading of the prizes, the sale of the goods contained therein, and the payment of those sold to the State, as well as for sending reports to Montevideo.

Article 5 — All prizes containing dry goods or war materials shall be sent to Mostardas, running aground at the agreed point; as for other prizes, the commander will give the appropriate destination, sinking those that are not useful.

Article 6 — Half of the proceeds from the prizes, once settled, shall be promptly delivered to the commander and prize crews.

Article 7 — The other half shall be delivered to the shipowners, who will divide it equally.

Article 8 — Partner Jerônimo shall be responsible for the goods of the prizes he disposes of, and partner Captain Roberto likewise for prizes destined for other points, being required to give repeated notices.

And thus agreeing, they sign three copies of this content, so that each partner may keep one.

City of Piratini, January 26, 1839.  
Domingos José de Almeida  
Roberto G. Bisley  
Jerônimo Teixeira de Almeida

Partnership agreement for a privateer.
